item.description:
For those of you who want to hike off the turkey coma, I offer a great hike to Leaterman's Cave. This hike is near Black Rock State Park but not in it. The Leatherman hiked a loop 365 mile long from the Connecticut River to the Hudson River between 1858 and 1889. His clothing was made entirely from leather scraps.

This hike takes you up to a picturesque plateau overlooking the valley and Rt. 8. There are ups but it is worth the challenge to see the views and the rockfall cave. The trail should be no more than 5 miles and we should be done by 2:00. Bring water and a snack for a break in the cave.

The directions lead you to Black Rock State Park. DO NOT GO INTO THE PARK. When you reach the park entrance, continue west on route 6. As you head up the big hill, the trail head will be on your left. We will be parking on the road. I cannot find maps for this section of the trail. You'll just have to trust I know where I'm going.

Please wear hiking boots and appropriate clothing for the temperature that day. Rain will cancel the event.


Mapquest link: http://www.mapquest.c...


=== Legal Stuff ===
By clicking on "Yes" or "Maybe" for this event you agree, warrant, and covenant as follows:

In consideration for accepting this entry, I, the registrant, intending to be legally bound, hereby, for myself, my heirs, my executors and administrators, do waive and release any and all rights for damages I may have against any parties or persons connected with the Hartford Area Hiking meetup group for and related to the above listed event. I attest and verify that I am physically fit to participate in any portion of this above listed event. I grant Hartford Area Hiking permission to use any photographs, film or videotapes of this event for any purpose.
item.how_to_find_us: I have a Silver Jeep Liberty.
